title: Behind tariff chaos, the deep roots of the Trump doctrine
summary: While the US president has had to back down on his trade war, the ideological foundation of his decisions is more solid than their confusing, clumsy and brutal form suggests. Trumpism has long-established origins, and it is here to stay.

title: Trump says that US may 'pass' on Ukraine peace talks if no progress soon
summary: The US government said that it was willing to abandon talks to end the Russia-Ukraine conflict if no progress was made in the next few days.

title: White House site blames China for Covid-19 'lab leak'
summary: The Covid.gov site also targets Anthony Fauci, Biden's former chief medical advisor, for advancing the 'narrative' that the virus 'originated naturally.' The lab-leak theory, once dismissed as a conspiracy theory, has regained traction in the US. Earlier this year, the CIA shifted its official stance on the virus's origin, saying that it was 'more likely' leaked from a Chinese lab than transmission from animals.

title: Hezbollah 'will not let anyone disarm' it, says chief
summary: The militant group leader Naim Qassem's comments came hours after another Hezbollah official said the group refused to discuss handing over its weapons unless Israel withdrew completely from south Lebanon and halted its 'aggression.'

title: Abrego Garcia told visiting senator he was no longer being held at notorious Salvadoran prison
summary: President Donald Trump and El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele intend to keep Kilmar Abrego Garcia out of the United States, even as officials in Trump's Republican administration have called his deportation a mistake and the US Supreme Court has called on the administration to facilitate his return.

title: Thirty years of plastic pollution found in Amsterdam coots' nests
summary: Lacking vegetation, the birds populating the canals of the Netherlands' capital use refuse to build their nests; a stratigraphic study revealed hundreds of plastic waste items, sometimes dating back decades.

title: King Leopold III planned to rule over a mini-Belgium aligned with Adolf Hitler
summary: A World War II-era archival document, drafted by the monarch's advisers and unearthed by a Belgian historian, sheds light on a highly contested period in the nation's history: the king's intention to lead a truncated state with the Führer's consent.

title: US Vice President Vance meets Meloni in Rome before Easter at the Vatican
summary: JD Vance is in Rome for talks on tariffs with Italy's Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni. The US and Italy have a good relationship, despite differing views on the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: Trump administration looks into whether they can fire Federal Reserve chief
summary: After Jerome Powell warned that Donald Trump's sweeping global tariffs would push up prices for Americans, the US government has been 'studying' the prospect of firing him.

title: Quai Branly exposes its counter-investigation on the Dakar-Djibouti mission and its looting of objects under the guise of science
summary: The Parisian museum has invited African researchers to study the archives of the expedition that took place between 1931 and 1933, and to conduct field studies to trace the conditions of collection.

title: French government divided over proposal to raise tax on the wealthy
summary: In the name of tax justice, Minister of Economy and Finance Eric Lombard, has proposed making a temporary tax on the wealthy 'permanent.' Macron's camp is firmly opposed to the idea.

title: War in Ukraine: In Paris, first talks between Americans, Ukrainians and Europeans yield no real breakthrough
summary: President Emmanuel Macron used the visit of US Secretary of State Marco Rubio and special envoy Steve Witkoff as an opportunity to also invite Ukrainian and European representatives.

title: US strikes an oil port in Yemen, killing dozens
summary: According to Yemen's Houthi rebels, the airstrikes killed 74 people, making it the deadliest attack under Trump thus far. Meanwhile, the US alleged a Chinese satellite company had been 'directly supporting' Houthi attacks.

title: Qatar flexes its diplomatic muscles in Africa, with mixed results
summary: The emirate is increasingly involved in mediating conflict across the continent, where it has growing influence. But not all of its forays into mediation have been successful.

title: Ukraine intensifies use of land mines against Russia
summary: Near the Zaporizhzhia front, Ukrainians are producing their own explosive devices and transporting them via drones – a way to offset their numerical disadvantage.

title: Heavy spring snowstorm in the Alps leaves two people missing
summary: An unusually intense spring storm triggered avalanches, transport shutdowns and blackouts across the Alps, catching residents and authorities off guard.

title: Coffee, cocoa, vanilla: The severe social and environmental impacts of foods imported to France
summary: A recent study scrutinizes 13 major import sectors based on their CO₂ emissions, their impact on deforestation, their use of child labor and producers' standard of living.

title: 'Incredulous' at Trump's trade war, the European Central Bank continues to lower interest rates
summary: Interest rates were reduced from 2.5% to 2.25% on Thursday, marking the seventh consecutive cut. The ECB believes that the tariffs will be 'negative' for European growth.

title: What could happen to Le Pen's conviction before the 2027 presidential election?
summary: The far-right leader was sentenced, at the end of March, to a five-year ban on running for office. She has appealed. Two years ahead of the presidential election, many questions remain regarding the upcoming stages of Marine Le Pen's legal procedure.

title: At least 143 dead in DR Congo boat fire
summary: The total number of passengers on board the doomed vessel was not known, but an official from the region said it was in the "hundreds."

title: In Georgia, the government intensifies the repression of its opponents as protests dwindle
summary: The ruling party, Georgian Dream, has increased intimidation and legislative measures to undermine the movement and to ban opposition parties.

title: A busy caterpillar, guardian of its domain
summary: Smaller than a grain of rice, the Falcaria bilineata caterpillar uses undetectable vibratory strategies to defend its tiny territory, recently amplified and revealed by the work of Canadian biologists.

title: 2027 French election: The growing prospect of a CEO for president
summary: The French political landscape currently seems ripe for a major business leader to step onto the national stage. Emmanuel Macron's unexpected rise to power in 2017 has inspired the most ambitious figures.

title: Iran, US to hold second round of high-stakes nuclear talks in Rome
summary: Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi is slated to hold a second round of Oman-mediated talks with US Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff in Rome on Saturday.

title: Tunisian court sentences opposition figures to up to 66 years in prison
summary: Well-known opposition figures, lawyers and business people were sentenced on Saturday for openly criticizing Tunisian President Kais Saied.

title: JD Vance heads to Vatican after Pope France rebuke over US deportation policies
summary: The US vice president will meet a top Vatican official on Saturday amid tensions with Pope Francis over immigration, the war in the Gaza Strip and the freezing of international humanitarian aid.

title: Students, journalists on trial in Turkey over Istanbul protests
summary: Ninety-nine defendants in one case appeared in court on Friday in Istanbul's Çaglayan neighborhood to face charges of participating in unauthorized demonstrations organized to protest the arrest of the city's mayor, Ekrem Imamoglu.

title: Putin announces 'Easter truce' in Ukraine
summary: The Russian president announced a truce in its war on Ukraine from 6 pm Moscow time to midnight Sunday.

title: In Israel, protests and 'fatigue' among reservists over the war in Gaza
summary: Reservists and retirees from the army and security services have denounced the impasse of the Netanyahu government's strategy in open letters published in the press.

title: Lyon beats Arsenal 2-1 in first leg of Women's Champions League semifinals
summary: Melchie Dumornay impressed for Lyon throughout, striking the crossbar with a 40-meter shot in the 33rd minute before eventually finding the target to halt Arsenal's second-half momentum and bolster her reputation as one of the world's best young players.

title: Karl Lagerfeld, on the road to Memphis
summary: In 1981, the German fashion designer moved into a high-rise in Monaco and furnished his apartment with the playful designs of the Memphis movement, which had emerged in Italy that same year. This iconoclastic interior is on display at the Almine Rech gallery in Monaco, where it has been meticulously recreated.

title: Ecuador on 'maximum alert' over alleged assassination plot against president-elect Noboa
summary: Ecuador intelligence said people planned to enter the country from Mexico to assassinate the recently reelected Daniel Noboa, who will be sworn in on May 24.

title: Iran, US conclude second round of high-stakes nuclear talks in Rome
summary: The Oman-mediated talks between the US and Iran on reaching an agreement on its nuclear program lasted around four hours.
